article.Body:
In CNBC TV-18’s special series, Hello GST, V Lakshmikumaran, Managing Partner, Lakshmikumaran & Sridharan decodes the impact of the Goods and Services Tax (GST) on the banking sector.

Laksmikumaran highlights that currently tax is applied only on the fee income earned by banks and not on the interest income. There is also reversal of 50 percent of the tax credit taken.  

Under GST, input services will be taxed at 18 percent. This will mean higher cost of funds and banks will only be able to reduce the pressure by either increasing the fees or the rate of interest.

“GST will increase the tax burden and may mean an increase in the fees and the cost of loans”, Lakshminarayan says.
